description: Master Bing Places for Business to capture market share from Microsoft users, improve local search visibility, and diversify your local SEO strategy.

requirements: Complete business address and contact information

sections.title: Set Up Your Bing Places for Business Account
sections.content:
Bing Places for Business is Microsoft's local business directory platform that helps you reach users on Bing search, Microsoft Edge, and Windows devices. While Google dominates search, Bing still captures 6-7% of searches and has higher-value users in many demographics.

Getting Started:

  1. Visit bingplaces.com and sign in with your Microsoft account
  2. If you don't have a Microsoft account, create one using your business email
  3. Search for your business by name and address
  4. If found, claim the existing listing; if not, add your business
  5. Verify your authority to manage the business listing

Business Information Requirements:

  • Business Name: Use your official legal business name without promotional language
  • Address: Complete street address that matches your physical location
  • Phone Number: Primary business phone number (local preferred over toll-free)
  • Website URL: Your main business website
  • Category: Select the most accurate primary category for your business
  • Description: Brief description highlighting your key services and unique value

Verification Process:

  • Phone verification: Bing may call your business number to verify
  • Postcard verification: Some businesses receive verification postcards
  • Email verification: Verification may be sent to your business email
  • Verification typically takes 1-3 business days

Why Bing Places Matters:

  • Bing users tend to be older, more affluent, and make higher-value purchases
  • Windows 10/11 and Microsoft Edge users see Bing results by default
  • Less competition means easier ranking opportunities
  • Bing integrates with Cortana voice search
  • Microsoft's business tools (Office 365, Teams) drive commercial searches
tips: Use the same Microsoft account you use for other business tools for easier management
Ensure your business phone number is answered during business hours for verification
Keep your NAP information identical to your Google My Business listing

sections.title: Optimize Your Bing Places Listing for Maximum Visibility
sections.content:
A well-optimized Bing Places listing can help you capture valuable local traffic that many businesses ignore:

Business Information Optimization:

  • Categories: Choose the most specific primary category and add relevant secondary categories
  • Business Description: Write a compelling 200-300 word description with relevant keywords
  • Services: List all services you offer to help customers find you for various needs
  • Payment Methods: Include all accepted payment options
  • Parking Information: Specify parking availability and type
  • Accessibility: Note wheelchair accessibility and other accommodations

Contact and Hours Optimization:

  • Include multiple contact methods: phone, email, website
  • Add social media profiles if actively maintained
  • Set detailed operating hours for each day of the week
  • Include special hours for holidays and events
  • Add temporary closures or modified hours when needed

Visual Content Strategy:

  • Logo: Upload a high-quality square logo (minimum 200x200 pixels)
  • Business Photos: Include exterior and interior shots of your business
  • Product/Service Photos: Showcase what you offer with high-quality images
  • Team Photos: Include professional photos of your staff
  • Action Shots: Show your business in operation or customers using your services

Local SEO Optimization:

  • Include local keywords naturally in your business description
  • Mention nearby landmarks, neighborhoods, or areas you serve
  • Include your city and state in your description
  • Reference local partnerships or community involvement
  • Use industry-specific keywords that your customers search for
tips: Update your listing whenever you make changes to avoid inconsistencies
Use high-quality photos that look professional and represent your business well
Include keywords that Windows and business users might search for

sections.title: Leverage the Microsoft Ecosystem for Business Growth
sections.content:
Microsoft's ecosystem offers unique opportunities for businesses to reach professional and enterprise customers:

Microsoft Search Integration:

  • Bing powers search within Microsoft Office applications
  • Windows 10/11 search incorporates Bing results
  • Microsoft Teams and Outlook can surface local business information
  • Cortana voice assistant uses Bing for local recommendations
  • Xbox and other Microsoft devices default to Bing search

Professional User Base:

  • Bing users are more likely to be business professionals and decision-makers
  • Higher average household income compared to other search engines
  • More likely to research B2B services and professional solutions
  • Often searching from corporate networks and business environments

Microsoft Advertising Integration:

  • Link your Bing Places account with Microsoft Advertising for paid campaigns
  • Use location extensions in your Microsoft Ads
  • Create location-based ad campaigns targeting local customers
  • Leverage Bing's lower cost-per-click compared to Google Ads

Bing Webmaster Tools Connection:

  • Connect your business website to Bing Webmaster Tools
  • Monitor how your website appears in Bing search results
  • Submit your sitemap to improve indexing
  • Track search performance and keyword rankings
  • Identify technical SEO issues affecting your Bing visibility

Voice Search Optimization:

  • Optimize for Cortana voice searches on Windows devices
  • Include conversational keywords and phrases
  • Focus on 'near me' and local intent queries
  • Ensure your business name is easily pronounceable
tips: Consider the professional context of many Bing searches when creating content
Integrate your Bing Places strategy with your Microsoft Advertising campaigns
Monitor search queries in Bing Webmaster Tools to optimize your listing

sections.title: Capitalize on Bing's Competitive Advantages
sections.content:
Many businesses neglect Bing, creating opportunities for those who optimize their presence on Microsoft's platform:

Lower Competition Benefits:

  • Fewer businesses optimize for Bing, making it easier to rank well
  • Less crowded search results mean more visibility for your business
  • Lower competition in paid advertising results in better ROI
  • Easier to dominate local search results in your industry

Unique Bing Features:

  • Visual Search: Bing's image search can drive discovery for visual businesses
  • Rich Snippets: Better support for certain types of structured data
  • Local Pack: Often shows more local results than Google
  • Integration Features: Deep integration with Microsoft Office suite

Target Audience Advantages:

  • Bing users are more likely to complete purchases and take action
  • Higher engagement rates on local business listings
  • More B2B and professional services searches
  • Users who intentionally choose Bing often have specific preferences

Cross-Platform Strategy:

  • Use Bing Places as part of a comprehensive local SEO strategy
  • Maintain consistency across Google, Bing, and other platforms
  • Track performance differences between platforms
  • Adjust strategies based on platform-specific user behavior

Long-Term Positioning:

  • Microsoft continues to invest in search technology and AI
  • Integration with Microsoft's AI and ChatGPT could increase relevance
  • Early adoption positions you well for future growth
  • Diversification protects against over-reliance on Google
tips: Don't neglect Bing just because it has smaller market share - the users are valuable
Use Bing as a testing ground for strategies you might apply to Google
Monitor Microsoft's developments in AI and search to stay ahead

sections.title: Monitor Performance and Maintain Your Listing
sections.content:
Regular monitoring and maintenance ensure your Bing Places listing continues to perform effectively:

Performance Monitoring:

  • Bing Places Dashboard: Monitor views, clicks, and customer actions
  • Bing Webmaster Tools: Track search performance and keyword rankings
  • Website Analytics: Monitor traffic from Bing using UTM parameters
  • Microsoft Advertising: If using paid ads, track location extension performance

Key Metrics to Track:

  • Profile views and impressions
  • Clicks to website, phone calls, and direction requests
  • Search queries that led users to your listing
  • Conversion rates from Bing traffic
  • Ranking positions for important local keywords

Regular Maintenance Tasks:

  • Monthly Reviews: Check all information for accuracy
  • Photo Updates: Add new photos quarterly
  • Hours Updates: Keep operating hours current
  • Service Updates: Add new services or products as you offer them
  • Seasonal Adjustments: Update for seasonal hours or services

Quality Assurance:

  • Test all contact methods regularly
  • Verify your business appears correctly in Bing Maps
  • Check that all links work properly
  • Ensure photos are displaying correctly
  • Monitor for duplicate or conflicting listings

Optimization Opportunities:

  • Analyze which search terms bring customers to your listing
  • Update your description based on successful keywords
  • Add new photos based on what customers engage with most
  • Refine your categories if new options become available
  • Expand your service area if you grow your coverage

Integration with Other Efforts:

  • Coordinate updates across all directory platforms
  • Use insights from Bing to improve other listings
  • Integrate Bing performance data into overall marketing reports
  • Consider Bing-specific content or promotions based on user behavior
tips: Set monthly calendar reminders to review and update your listing
Track seasonal patterns in Bing traffic to optimize timing of promotions
Use Bing's lower competition to test new keywords and strategies
